channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [TINKERPOP-2585] Traversal failed for different strategies order
item.description:
Test randomly reproduced, empirically failed when PathRetractionStrategy apply before InlineFilterStrategy

https://gist.github.com/mad/3027855063bed41bae0a2aa7d2051352

In real code strategies may change order during static vars initialized 

0

watch -e -n 0.1 'mvn verify  -Dit.test=TraversalFailIT -l 1.log'
item.summary: Traversal failed for different strategies order

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
there does seem to be some sort of bad interaction between PathRetractionStrategy and InlineFilterStrategy. When I run your test though I can't get it to pass unless I wholly remove one or the other (or both). the failure doesn't happen on 3.4.x so i suppose it is exposed by way of the revised strategy application order.

I've tested a change that ensures that InlineFilterStrategy applies before PathRetractionStrategy and found it to work with your test (i.e. it no longer throws that exception). I need to run the full test suite to validate, but perhaps that's the solution here. Not sure if i'm missing something though - might need to think on it further. If you have other thoughts, please let me know.

spmallette opened a new pull request #1460:
URL: https://github.com/apache/tinkerpop/pull/1460

https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/TINKERPOP-2585

Addressed two separate but perhaps related bugs given the strategy order changes for 3.5.0. The comments on each commit will provide more details.

All tests pass with `docker/build.sh -t -n -i`

VOTE +1

–
